notes.title: AI Overhaul
changes: 5 distinct AI personality types with unique strategies
Aggressive: Combat focused with fewer scouts, attacks quickly with heavy mechs
Balanced: Mix of exploration and combat, defends then attacks (default)
Defensive: Slow expansion, prioritizes fortifications, keeps mechs near planets
Expansionist: Heavy exploration with 10 scouts, builds attack forces methodically
Infestor: Swarm tactics with cheap light/medium mechs, rapid expansion
AI type now displayed next to empire name (e.g. 'Empire Name (AI - Aggressive)')
AI logging disabled in production for performance
Removed legacy Normal AI type
Turn summary now shows 'Earnings' with breakdown by planets and mining colonies
AI now detects overwhelming force (3x enemy mechs) and attacks aggressively
AI finishing blow logic improved - commits all forces when dominant
Fixed AI not attacking enemy's final planets
Added Observable Games section - watch active games you're not part of
Major server performance fix - debounced database saves instead of per-operation
Fixed N+1 query pattern in planet/building loading
Mech tooltip now shows breakdown by type with icons for your mechs
AI now builds 5 light scouts for exploration and capturing undefended planets
AI only produces combat mechs (medium+) after first enemy contact
Scouts spread out across the map to maximize territory discovery
Fixed defense HP showing as undefined in Planet Management
AI players now recover and submit turns after server restart
Turn count only shows while dragging, not on placed waypoint arrows
Fixed move arrow not updating when overriding a waypoint with a 1-tile move
Reduced planet spacing to 3.5 tiles for denser maps
Waypoints now show in Mech Management screen with turn count
Fixed cancelling orders from Mech Management not removing map arrows
Mechs with waypoints only show one arrow to final destination
Tooltip now shows coordinates and 'Empty Space' for empty tiles
Patch notes modal now accessible from game screen

notes.title: Waypoint Navigation
changes: Drag mechs beyond adjacent tiles to set waypoint destinations
Mechs automatically move toward waypoints at 1 tile per turn
Dashed arrows show path to waypoint with turn count labels
Waypoints persist across turns until destination is reached
Adjacent tiles highlighted in blue, distant tiles in yellow during drag
Orders panel shows waypoint routes with remaining turn count
Increased planet spacing to 4-5 tiles apart for more strategic map
Added 500 unique planet names loaded from JSON
Added Patch Notes modal - click version number to view
Major versions display with gold headings and titles
Minor versions display with blue headings
Hotfixes display with smaller grey headings
Fixed observer mode UI - submit button no longer reappears on turn refresh
Hidden Planet Management and Mech Management buttons in observer mode
Star Empires list now updates on turn refresh when modal is open
Fixed lobby player counts to exclude Pirates faction
Active games now show "X/Y Players Remaining" format
Added remaining_players count for active games
Fixed Retire feature - Pirates now properly excluded from turn submissions
Pirates no longer appear in Star Empires list or observer panel
Fixed confirmRetire calling non-existent function
Added Retire button to surrender your empire to Pirates
Pirates faction created - dark grey neutral faction that takes over retired empires
Retired players enter observer mode to watch the rest of the game
Improved AI exploration - AI now actively scouts the map
AI claims neutral planets with light mechs
AI builds scout mechs when low on explorers
Added AI log culling to keep only 10,000 most recent lines
Server-side order storage implemented
Orders now persist across page refreshes
Fixed various order synchronization issues

notes.title: Star Empires Update
changes: Added Star Empires panel showing all players and their status
Empire colors and names displayed throughout the game
Turn submission status visible for all players
Added Mech Management panel for organizing your forces

notes.title: The AI Awakens
changes: Added AI players to fill empty slots
AI makes strategic decisions for movement and building
AI aggressively pursues enemy planets and defends its own
Improved combat resolution and balance

notes.title: Fog of War
changes: Added fog of war - only see tiles near your planets and mechs
Visibility range: 3 tiles from planets, 2 tiles from mechs
Enemy movements hidden until they enter your visibility
Strategic scouting now required for map awareness

notes.title: Initial Release
changes: Core gameplay: planets, mechs, buildings, and combat
Turn-based multiplayer with configurable timers
Four mech types: Light, Medium, Heavy, and Assault
Three building types: Mining Colony, Factory, and Fortification
Google OAuth authentication
Real-time turn notifications via SSE
